str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Plural
Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To follow after. From kata and akoloutheo; to accompany closely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
